abstract: John Podesta, who ran President Obama's transition team and served as White House chief of staff to President Clinton, will step down as president of the Center for American Progress.
snippet: John Podesta, who ran President Obama's transition team and served as White House chief of staff to President Clinton, will step down as president of the Center for American Progress.
lead_paragraph: John Podesta, who ran President Obama's transition team and served as White House chief of staff to President Clinton, will step down as president of the Center for American Progress, a research organization that represents the views of the president's more liberal, and somewhat disaffected, base. He will be replaced by Neera Tanden, but will remain at the organization as non-executive chairman of the board. Read more »

headline.main: Podesta to Step Down as Head of Liberal Think Tank
